intro: Tontelea madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar tontelea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
